rules.natural: Either the crew captures a lion or a backup generator is available.
Provided that the lion is animal visible, if the camera battery is low then it is not the case that the crew captures a lion.
Whenever the lion is in frame, it follows that the lion is animal visible.
Under the condition that the crew is on location in the savanna, the lion is in frame.

If the crew applies manual override to the camera, then if it is not the case that if the crew is not on location in the savanna then the weather is good in the savanna, it follows that it is not the case that the crew is at a safe distance from the lion.
Either the crew applies manual override to the camera or the camera is in auto mode.

If the camera is in auto mode, then given that it is not the case that if the crew is not on location in the savanna then the weather is good in the savanna, the crew is not at a safe distance from the lion.
Either the director approves the shot or the producer approves the shot.

In the event that the producer approves the shot, then if it is not the case that if the camera has power then it is not the case that the crew captures a lion, and this leads to using the backup camera, then it is not the case that the lion is animal disturbed.
If the camera has power, then the camera battery is low.
